About

Graduating from University of South Australia (Visual Communication â€“ Honours 1999) Timothy lived and worked in Melbourne from 2000 until 2007, working for many high-profile design and advertising agencies as well as maintaining his own freelance practice. In May 2001 he co-founded independent art space Bus with five fellow designers/artists. Acting as co-director until 2004, and sole director until 2007 Timothy also initiated and managed numerous external projects (local, national and international) including exhibitions in Sydney, Hobart, Osaka and London.

At the end of 2007 Timothy relocated to Yogyakarta, Indonesia where he worked for social arts and environmental organisations Performance Klub and Hutan Pangan. Responsible for media communications Timothy was also actively involved in the management of events, sourcing of support and funding and the development and implementation of new programs.

In 2010 Timothy co-founded arts/music project Yes No Klub with prominent local arts manager Wok the Rock of Yes No Wave and MES 56. The project concentrates on providing opportunities for musicians/sound produces from outside of Indonesia to collaborate with Indonesian musicians and artists. Yes No Klub is presently a host organisation for the University of Melbourne's AsiaLink artists in residency program and has an on-going project with the German cultural center Goethe-Institute and Germany's CTM Festival for Adventurous Music and Art, Singapore's Playfreely/Blackkaji and Manila's WSK Festival entitled Nusasonic.

In 2012 Timothy established Oxen Free on the renowned tourist and nightlife street of Jalan Sosrowijayan. Oxen Free was one of the first (of now many) beer garden / venues in Yogyakarta. Oxen Free is located in an historic Dutch colonial building meters away from Jalan Malioboro. Offering a diverse menu of Western and Indonesian food, range of beers and mixed drinks Oxen Free also offers a regular program of live music, local DJs and frequently plays host to events and happenings.
